text:
Kita membooking villa 3 kamar tidur via whatssap utk 7 malam, dan diharuskan untuk membayar full payment
- kita tiba di lokasi sekitar pukul 15.00
- baru diberitahu bahwa villa yg kami sewa berada di lantai teratas (rooftop)
- lalu kita menyampaikan ke pihak hotel untuk menginap 1 sampai 2 malam, dan meminta refund untuk malam berikutnya
- pertama kita ditemui oleh manager hotel dan akhirnya sampai bertemu dengan general managernya pun tidak meberikan win win solution
Dan dari jawabannya nampaknya General Manager yg bernama Mr. Thomas ini sudah sering menghadapi masalah ini 
- ada perbedaan dari quotation dan reservation,
   Di quotation tidak dicantumkan bahwa bookingan non refundable 
Tetapi setelah melakukan full payment , lsg dicantumkan bahwa booking bersifat non refundable
- kolam renangnya dalamnya hanya setinggi pinggang
- area living roomnya sangat panas dan terik karena berada di atap lantai 3
- sangat bising karena tepat berada di pinggir jalan raya
title: Resort panas di atas atap

owner_response.text:
Dear adityaprimadi,

Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. Your feedback is important and we rely on hearing from our guests to ensure we’re doing a great job. We’re sorry to hear about your experience. We’re usually known for our exceptional customer service and we regret that we didn’t live up to those expectations here.

We understand you’re feeling disappointed about booking The Penthouse given surprise it is on the top floor of the building of the villa resort. After meeting with you and explaining limited villas availability due to high occupation, we offered you to use the last available villa for free of charge during your whole stay and you accepted it. Your very special rate was non-refundable because was linked to your minimum length of stay. Despite this fact later we offered you that you can shorten your stay, but you decided to stay full origin booking stay, what we were grateful for it.

Hopefully, we can continue to serve you giving you the best customer service guaranteed. 

Deep sincerity,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
After arriving on a almost 27 hour journey from Toronto we were exhausted. We had booked this Villa as it was in the centre of Seminyak and we were not disappointed. It is very clean and modern we had the 3 room Villa on the Rooftop with our own private pool, Butler Service  and lounging area it was absolutely spectacular. 

The booking came with Butler Service that attended to our breakfast needs in the morning and anything we needed throughout the day. We had fresh fruits, cereals and choices of breakfast dishes both traditional as well as North American type cuisine. 

We spent a good portion of the morning swimming in the pool chatting or having a drink at poolside and after a long day, a dip at midnight was amazing. 

Our Butler Service was excellent they introduced us to the most valuable guide in Bali Ketut who I would highly recommend he speaks English fluently is knowledgeable about some of the tours and we use them throughout our stay he can be reached at tourbalinese@gmail.com I quite liked his service and would highly recommend him. Well done for the staff and ownership of 111 this most definitely is a place I would go back.
title: WOW!!! MUST BOOK THE PLACE IS BEAUTIFUL!!

text:
After much deliberation we chose to spend 2 weeks at One Eleven. This was our third trip to Bali and we were keen to just chill out and relax in Seminyak, an area we have come to enjoy. We had seen One Eleven on previous visits and were impressed with it’s simple yet modern exterior. We were not disappointed!
The villa was fantastic - private, spacious and peaceful. The simple yet luxurious design surpassed our expectations. We found all rooms in our Villa very comfortable and appreciated the minimalist aesthetic. The pool, by the way, was exceptional and used extensively.
What really made the stay truly memorable was the excellent One Eleven team. Everyone, without exception, was friendly, extremely helpful and obliging - a real credit to One Eleven.
Our special thanks to Wijaya, Sinta, Mira, Kadek and Adi for helping make our stay so enjoyable. Special thanks also to the security team for their help and assistance when my phones were stolen by someone on a scooter when we were returning from dinner one evening. 
We highly recommend One Eleven to anyone looking for quality accommodation in the heart of Seminyak - you won’t be disappointed! Already planning our return 😉
title: Simply Superb!

text: This place was just beautiful - relaxing and peaceful, really attentive staff, and picture perfect. Our villa was much bigger than we were expecting, the pool is such a generous size and the open layout of the villa was really, really cool. Breakfast is chosen from a special menu the day before  and there are lots of options then it is cooked and prepared exactly when you would like it. We ventured out for little walks around Seminyak to shop and try some of the food around - don't miss Bo and Bun (really fresh and delicious Vietnamese) and we were very impressed by the stylish Japanese restaurant upstairs above the reception area at One Eleven. Definitely go there if you love Japanese. We had inroom tspa treatments and personal yoga lessons, everything seamlessly arranged for us - just go already!

text: Our villa at One Eleven was stunning. The private pool was large and inviting. The design of the villa was sleek and modern. The bed and outdoor couch were super comfortable. The breakfasts were excellent, and the w-fi worked well. It's cool that they have blue tooth speakers that allow you to play your music outside. The staff is also very friendly and helpful. One night we were going to meet friends in Canggu (around 30 minutes away by car). We asked the staff about how to get there. And we were so surprised when they offered to drop us off there for free! They had already been very generous with arranging free shuttles for us around Seminyak. But the ride to Canggu struck us as going above and beyond. I definitely recommend One Eleven to anyone looking for a beautiful and welcoming place to stay in Seminyak.
title: Fantastic experience

text:
After staying at St Regis Bali, we decided to extend our trip in Bali for one more night. We looked online and wanted to have a villa experience this trip, so we finally decided on One Eleven and oh man....it was worth it. Best decision I made in 2018 so far.

The service was wonderful, they have sent a car to St Regis to pick us up and it only took about 40-50 mins from Nusa Dua to the hotel. Check in was quick and painless, and they showed us to the villa. 

As soon as the butler opened the door, my gf and I were in awe. The property is amazing! I loved the design cues and the pool is HUGE for villa standards. We also loved the amenities, especially the slipper, it is quite stylish. The location of the villa is about 10-15 minutes walk to the shopping/food area but they do provide a shuttle car for your convenience. 

For breakfast, they will come to your villa and cook the food for you right there, nothing beats that. We also partook in the in-villa massage and that was seriously just cherry on top. Absolutely loved it.

We will definitely be back.
title: Seriously the BEST

text: We stayed for 6 nights at One eleven last week. We didn't know what to expect as we heard less than good things about Seminyak and the chaos there, but 111 is an excellent choice. From the large villa to the huge private pool - to the personalised yet efficient service - we can not fault this resort. We were so happy we ended up at One eleven and stayed in the villa more than normal I think. We love that it is a quiet, child free place and that it is smoke free (?) too. The bathroom was huge with very nice bathroom products, the bed was very comfortable and the breakfasts were wonderful and decadent. The food was really good and we ate a lot of lunches and dinners there too. The service was really good and the staff is very sweet and service minded. We really enjoyed both in house massages as well and tried to book a third one before we left, but the spa was full.  One tiny piece of feedback for change is that we believed the free shuttle also could pick us up after we were done eating at night if it wasn't too late, but that never happened and we never understood wh,y as there were cars and drivers available (we think,) and not much traffic either.  All in all we had a blast at villa 8 and will book 111 again if we go back to Bali.
title: Had a blast at 111

owner_response.text:
Dear Travelbird0505,

text:
Where to start?! Everything about One Eleven was absolutely magical. We had the most incredible stay here. 

When we first arrived the charming security guard welcomed us and showed us in where we met by the wonderful lady behind reception who gave us a cold towel and delicious welcome drink. 

We were driven about 20 metres in the buggy to our villa. As soon as the entrance door was opened, our jaws dropped. We were blown away by the sheer size of our own private villa. We weren't expecting a villa so big, a pool so big, a garden so big! 

One Eleven is very modern and as a result everything is so clean. Everything was impeccable.

The bed was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. The bathroom was beautiful with fresh towels constantly. The complimentary toiletries that they give you are all lovely. 

The service was outstanding. For breakfast, you have a private chef come to your villa to cook for you. You get a selection of fruits, bread, juice and tea anyway, but on top of that you can choose a dish from their daily menu. Between us we had eggs Benedict, French toast, an omelette and waffles. Everything was exceptional and such a treat to have it all made in front of you. 

What is nice about One Eleven is that their prices are really reasonable. Unlike other five star hotels who try to charge a fortune for food and spa treatments, everything at One Eleven, from massages to lunch, was better priced than a lot of places in town. Sadly we didn't get to try their Japenese restaurant, but if it's anything like their breakfast and lunch, I'm sure it's sensational! 

The service is second to none. Everyone is incredibly welcoming, kind and sincere. They go above and beyond to make sure everything is perfect. The complimentary private car service is a great added luxury.  

It's a 5 minute walk from restaurants and shops, but it feels like you're completely secluded. We had the best time at One Eleven and we can't recommend it enough. Our stay was absolutely faultless and we can't thank the staff enough for everything they did for us. We will return one day for a much longer stay :)
title: Wow! The most incredible place I've ever stayed!

text:
It's my beloved birthday, and I hadn't planned it out yet. Whats's worse is that it was peak season and I couldn't find a reservation anywhere, (Apart from the cheap places) there was limited availability.

................. time to break a sweat

Lucky for me, I found 1-11 listed on bookings.com website and as I was filling out the form I came across a section for special request, feeling streaky, I thought I'd try my luck and made a special request for a dozen red roses, a dozen white roses and petals on the bed sheet layer out to spell happy birthday Wendy for our arrival.

Upon our arrival to 1-11, the first thought that came to mind was 'they must have used high res cameras to take those display photos'.
(The place has its creaks and slight signs it's getting long in its tooth)

A short buggy ride carted us down to our private villa with our own pool (just like the photos) separate massage room, an open dining area and our sleeping quarters where they had arranged the two dozen roses, one white the other red, and spelt out Happy Bday Wendy as per my request. (What a way to win brownie points, and the trips only just started)

The things that I love about 1-11 was the service, they will do just about anything that you ask, provide that it's reasonable.

Breakfast is cooked at your villa by your own chef each morning, you can choose your menu the night before. The dry noodle was my favourite (migoreng).

Free 1 hour massage in your own private villa, or you can take a shuttle down to 1-11 day spa and treat yourself to the menu. 

Each afternoon, there is fumigation for mossie which can smoke up the villa, although it's only for a short time it does get smokey. Better than catching malaria or worse, dengue!

My overall experience was very pleasant and I would definitely revisit one eleven again. 

Value wise, its right up there with the pricing however it's worth it for all them extra brownie points 

Service is 9/10

text:
I'd been wanting to stay here for years, since a friend came back raving about how beautiful it was, and I finally got a chance to just a few days ago. It did not disappoint. 

The villas are huge and beautiful - I'm personally not a fan of the traditional Balinese heavy wood and stone decor, so I found the clean, modern aesthetic of the villas and the resort as a whole, just amazing. The resort's a mere 5 minute walk from shops and restaurants, but once you're in your villa, you might as well be miles away - the peace and tranquility were a welcome respite from the noise and activity around Seminyak. The room, pool and massage pavilion were very clean and well maintained, and we really appreciated the small touches the resort offered, e.g. fresh milk and slices of lemon in the fridge each day, plenty of beach towels and even head cushions for the deckchairs, a wide (and I mean WIDE) range of toiletries (with different ranges for men and women), offers to make up the room each time we ordered something, and the free car service around Seminyak!

Having breakfast cooked for you daily in your own kitchen rocks! The in-house room service menu was also decent, very very well priced, and had some interesting items, like a range of specially mixed teas/juices in jugs (perfect for spiking with your alcohol of choice). 

They really could do no wrong. We absolutely loved our stay, highly recommend it, and hope to be back soon!
title: amazing resort, completely lives up to the hype!

text:
It started with a smiling face waiting for us at the airport, and it ended with a warm goodbye and the genuine invitation to return back 'home' to One Eleven.

What happened in between to turn a 5 star hotel traveller into a 'villa' convert?  Well you just have to go yourself to find out!

From the moment we arrived, the staff welcome you with genuine warmth. 

The minimalistic entrance, the vertical gardens, and then the door is opened to your villa...... your spirit lifts and you know this is a special place.

It's not often that you find somewhere that looks as good, if not better than the marketing photos - but here you have found it - villa intoxication.

The understated luxury welcomes you and encourages you to unpack, relax, and enjoy every moment here.

Enter your air-conditioned bedroom, unpack in wardrobes that are larger than you have at home. 

Your bathroom, filled with lotions for him and her.  That stone bath beckoning you to fill it with water and sink into it.

The glistening water of the pool, the loungers positioned in the sun, the green manicured lawn..... you have made the right choice choosing One Eleven.

What about a spa treatment - well you have your own spa gazebo right next to the pool. They come fully prepared - even with soothing music - and massage away - bliss.

Breakfast carefully prepared in your villa at a time of your choice, with a selection you choose.  We had the Indonesian  breakfasts, which were delicious.

Room service prepared from their own kitchen, was quickly delivered, and each time set up on the dining table in your outdoor living room.  Food was fresh, interesting and prepared with a sense of pride.

Location of the villas is great. As first timers to Bali and Seminyak, we enjoyed that the restaurants where close by, the shopping a mere 5 minute walk away, and yet we were cocooned in a private and peaceful location.

Need to get to book a restaurant - just ask and it will be done for you.  What time is your dinner the staff ask - a car will be waiting to drive you there.

Absolutely nothing is too much for the staff - is there anything further we can do for you they ask..... the difference here is that they actually mean it.

Simple things, like a request for a lemon or lime for that G&T - delivered with a smile.

Would I change anything...... honestly no I wouldn't.  The luxury is provided, you have 24 hour room service, personal chefs to cook breakfast to you liking, your own huge pool, spa treatments and privacy to allow you to unwind from your daily stressful life.

text:
The villas are very luxurious and the pool very generously sized. The service is impeccable, but that is to be expected from a property of this calibre in Bali. The cooking of the breakfast fresh in the villa by a member of staff was a lovely touch. It was also fantastic to have a shuttle car at pretty much our beck and call, although my husband did have some issues with this airport transfer, although this was not OneEleven's problem, rather an issue with the increased traffic for the end of Ramadan.
I have not given it 5 stars for 3 reasons (all fairly minor but they did detract from our experience):
1) Noise is an issue. The way the villas are designed they are mirror images of each other, rather than exact replicas. This meant that our lounge room (villa 2) was right next to villa 3's lounge room, meaning that when they had the radio blaring at volume 5 million, it was rather intrusive. Similarly, the pool lounges for villa 1 were right next to our pool lounges. Villa 1 were having a rather epic party, including squealing, dive bombing, loud music etc. When we rang reception to ask if they could ask them to keep it down, we were told there was nothing that could be done. To be clear, unless I misread the vibe terribly, these are not party villas!
2) The sound system needs updating. The speaker does not connect via bluetooth and the USB did not work. The port was for an old style ipod. This meant that we (and our neighbours, because we could hear everything - see comment 1 above) could only really listen to local radio. Would have been nice to listen to our own music;
3) The tiles on the villa side of the pool area are VERY VERY slippery. I had quite a nasty fall when I was trying to get a towel, and hit my head quite hard. Obviously not the villa's fault (except perhaps in its design!) but worth noting to take extra care.

Very relaxing and lovely experience overall, would definitely consider it next time we are in Seminyak.
title: Lovely but not perfect

text:
I've stayed in Bali more than 10 times now and a vast majority of them have been in villas like this one but i must admit that this one could be the best one yet for a number of reasons... 

Firstly, its located far enough that you dont hear the hustle and bustle of the main street but close enough for you to walk and enjoy the numerous restaurants and my favourite, Ku De Ta. 

From the moment you arrive, you'll be greeted by extremely friendly and genuine staff you'd ever be fortunate to meet. This continues all the way to the villa as everyone is extremely kind and happy to assist you in any way possible. Unlike other villas, this one provides airport pick ups and drop offs but also to anywhere you'd for free! We got a ride to numerous places and called for a pickup when we were done. 

Which is pretty unheard of as only some 5 star hotels provide them for free. 

When you get to the villa, you'll notice just how lovely it looks. Very modern and clean.  As you walk in, you'll see the decent sized pool separating the living quarters. The room and bathroom are very clean which great for an OCD person like myself. The amount of lotions and hair products on offer is plain ludicrous and i had to stop my significant other from stealing them all. Wise men reading this, dont stop them. trust me, its not worth it. Calling them greedy is also unwise as i learned the hard way. 

Never come between a woman and her toiletries they say... 

if there was one thing that wasnt top notch, it was the air conditioning. it wasnt as cold as we'd have liked it to be. 

The food is pretty good although not amazing but thats fine as you'll have plenty of options just a couple hundred meters away. 

All in all, its a perfect place to stay and i would definitely come back. And that says a lot as I've never stayed in the same property twice. :)

Enjoy!

text:
We were there for holiday in early June 2015 and stayed for 3 nights. They were so patient and courteous from the time I corresponded with them via email until the day of our arrival. The drivers were waiting for us at the airport arrival hall when we landed at close to midnight. Although it was very late, they didn't show it and still greeted us with enthusiasm and smiling faces and even have cold towels and small bottle of mineral water prepared for us to freshen up. 

Throughout our stay there, it was the little things that make us feel welcome, appreciated, without being intrusive.

Location
I couldn't have chosen a better place and location. It's right at the heart of Seminyak, where it's lively at night and still out of the hustle and bustle; in a back lane, about 10 mins walk from the main street.

There are tons of shops to explore along the main street and a number of nice restaurants for you to dine. If you walk further down, you will come to Seminyak Square, where you can take a ride with Kura Kura bus and explore other areas such as Kuta, Sanur, Nusa, Jimbaran and etc.

On our last night, we decided to explore further down the main road of Seminyak and 15 mins later, we arrived at Ku De Ta. 

Taxis are easily available there at all times and do use the meter and select the ones that belongs to corporate.

Hotel
This is an all adult only hotel with 9 private one room villa with pool. Both its interior and exterior are modern and yet unassuming. There is the well-known Shiro Sushi Sake restaurant, which, unfortunately, we didn't manage to try at all. 

You could arrange with reception for driver to send and drop you off around Seminyak and pick-up later. This is subject to availability of driver.

Room
We loved the one bedroom villa and its privacy that comes with it. The lap pool is big enough for us to do some laps. There are deck chairs and towels for the pool that you can use and laze around the pool. In front of the pool is a gazebo in the villa and you can arrange for your own personal spa.

Dining room and kitchen are outdoor and mosquito coil and spray are provided too when evening comes. Kitchen is fully equipped with utensils, fridge, plates and bowls that you can buy food back, if you wish. There is self-complimentary Nespresso machine and TWG teas. Umbrellas are available should it rain. 

Room is spacious and the bed and pillows are heavenly. We even enjoyed the rain shower. There's even complimentary amenities provided; shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and soap for man and woman.  

In-villa services
We thoroughly enjoyed the luxurious daily breakfast that comes with the package and daily turn down service.

Service
The staff are friendly and professional, yet humble and very much like a family. They always greet or smile at us. Service is always top notch. We received a thank you email from David, the GM, a day after we arrived back home. 

If I am to nick pick, I'd say that the roof needs to be repaired as it was leaking when it rained and the Yamaha multimedia player is out-of-date. I would suggest that this be replaced with another player that is bluetooth enabled instead of using a specific usb that can only be used with iPhone or Android. As for the gazebo, it can be a little hot in the afternoon.

Overall, we are happy with our stay here and hope to go back again soon.
title: It was tranquil and quiet. Almost perfect !

text:
Stayed July 2015, Wow what a gem in Bali.  From the moment you are picked up from the airport, with cold water and fresh cold towel until you are transported into the most amazing villa you have ever seen.

Totally private, huge with the pool and garden area the same size as the villa.
The villa has everything you need:
The maxi bar, everything free with the exception of alcohol and snacks.  A delicious treat supplied daily.
The bathroom is wow with everything you need, shower gel, shampoo, toilet paste and brushes, razors, sunblock and mosquito repellent.
Every evening the butler provides the breakfast menu for the following day, and my how wonderful it is, cooked dish, cereal, yoghurt, breads, fresh fruit, fresh daily squeezed juices and tea, coffee.  It really is enough to last you until dinner.  All prepped in the villa.

The staff come in twice a day to clear up, but you would never know they are there.  All very attentive.  I personally believe they are one of the biggest and best things about your stay.  Cater for your every whim.

I celebrated my birthday and our 25th Wedding Anniversary and boy did they push out all the stops for it.  I won't spoil what was done, in case you think of celebrating too, but believe me you wouldn't miss it for the world.

You also have a spa gazebo in your garden, where you can have as many and little spa treatments you like.  Lovely touch when we left, we were given a CD of the music they play during these treatments, very relaxing.

Seminyak it a very vibrate place, the villas placed just off the road, there are nine villas, we stayed in No 8.  I don't think I would like villa No 1, as too near the road, although we didn't really here anything.

If you want to go out on day trips, One Eleven will organise and travel.   The in house drivers will also transport you to local areas.  My husband broke his glasses and they kindly arranged to go to the Opticians and arrange some birthday gifts - nothing was too much trouble.

Shiro, Japanese restaurant is wonderful, I love Japanese food and my husbands first time, but he has now been converted since the special dining experience.

I can't pin point the best bits because it truly is wonderful, but the staff go a long way to ensuring your experience is the best ever.  I really hope we manage to go back one day.

text:
We've just left the One Eleven resort and cannot wait to go back. What a fantastic experience!

These modern villas are stunning. Very modern and sleek with nice quality furnishing, sound system and a spectacular pool!

But the thing that really sets One Eleven apart is the level of service. Every person we dealt with was so kind and friendly, trying to help in whatever way they could and always with a nice big smile! Attention to detail was unparalleled, nice little touches everywhere, from amenities which even included mosquito repellent and his and hers body lotions, shampoo etc. to the villas being cleaned/towels changed several times a day but never intruding while we were in the villa.

Breakfast is cooked and laid out in your own villa at the time you request it. It is varied and delicious. We also had lunch served in the villa once and it was just great especially their Indonesian inspired food. 

I have never enjoyed a stay in a hotel more! In fact, it was so nice that we hardly left the villa. If you do leave, the resort is very close to Seminyak's main drag where you can find many cool restaurants and shops. If you decide to stay in for dinner there is also a delicious sushi bar with a Japanese chef on the premises which I would also recommend. 

My only constructive criticism is that some of the wood panelling in the ceiling in our villa had a bit of water damage and one stool in the massage room had a large stain. Just little things that could easily be rectified but that did not detract from the fantastic experience. 

Overall I would very highly recommend the One Eleven Resort!

text:
Stayed at One Eleven during Christmas last year, and LOVED (almost) everything about our stay. We were recommended to stay at One Eleven by word of mouth, and simply do not regret it at all. It's a perfect place to relax, unwind, and get some R&R. The only one regret was that our trip was not long enough in Bali, because we loved it so much it was hard to leave and we had booked all these restaurants which meant we didnt get to try One Eleven's Japanese restaurant, Shiro. We'll definitely be back though! Overall, we felt that this was one of the best places we have every stayed at on holiday and well worth every penny spent.

Pros:
1. Location - tucked away off the main street in Seminyak, it's just a five minute walk out to the hustle and bustle of Seminyak. We experienced no noise disturbance during our entire stay, it was so quiet despite most the villas being occupied.

2. Service - Absolutely impeccable. Everything was taken care of - even the little details. Our butler ensured that we were incredibly spoilt during our entire stay. Our favourite breakfast orders were memorised, and we were asked what we'd like the evening before for breakfast the next day. I loved the little night time desserts that were left for us every night - especially the Indonesian desserts! We received cute little cupcakes and cakes during Christmas. When staff members saw that we were walking out to Seminyak, we were asked if we would like a shuttle. Room was kept immaculate, our clothes even folded and placed neatly. We were incredibly spoilt. Every morning, breakfast was cooked to order and the selection was huge - there was no way we could finish everything we were plated. 

3. The Villa: all I can say is, WOW. From the design, the spa bale, the huge pool, the bathroom complete with huge bath tub, the outdoor patio area which was big enough that despite the villa not having gym facilities, I managed to do a bodyweight workout in that area every morning as it was big enough!...we could have actually just spent all day in the villa itself going from sun lounge, to pool, to patio lounger. Brilliant! I love the his and hers bathroom amenities which even included mosquito repellent and sunscreen, and differently scented toiletries. 

4. Spa: our stay included complimentary spa treatmentsin our private spa bale. The weather was pleasant enough that we didn't even need to have the air conditioning and it was amazing to have the spa bale doors open, with the cool sunset breeze coming in as we were getting pampered. Truly memorable.

If, and only if, I had to criticise would be the inflexibility of the meals that were part of our paid package - for example: for lunch, you could choose an appetiser, main and dessert. However, both my husband and I, generally don't take dessert but instead we asked for an extra serve of one of the mains. We were asked to pay for the additional - which is fine by us, but found it unusual that since we both already mentioned ahead by email before we arrived that we both would not like to have dessert, it would make sense to just let us have an additional main in replacement. 

We cannot wait to return!
title: Simply all around romantic and exceptional stay in Seminyak!

photos.caption: Staff preparing our breakfast - view from the pool

text:
I had the pleasure of staying at One Eleven for six nights with a friend in October 2014. The stay was superb.

I understand that the villas all have essentially the same design; an open plan kitchen and living area with an enclosed bedroom and bathroom area. The aesthetic quality of the villas exceeds even the professional photos on the website.  The furniture and wood paneling give the place a sense of luxury. Fresh flowers were placed every day. Lying around in the villa was a pleasure. 

The linens are crisp and fluffy, and there is extensive hanging space. The extremely stylish bathroom has a beautiful bath, and a rainforest shower that provided the best water pressure we found in Bali. 

The bathroom amenities are the best I’ve encountered in any hotel, anywhere, and included mosquito repellent to take with you (which was extremely useful) and sun care products. 

The villas are designed in a way that ensures a sense of privacy- you press a button to allow staff to enter. This really makes you feel like the space is your own.

The staff are delightful. Pleasant when you pass through reception, and (almost) never over bearing.  Everything was a phone call (or touch of a button) away. I was amazed that two mornings the villa was fully serviced and cleaned while we were having massages in  the  villa’s bale- it was silent, and perfect.

While the breakfast is nicely executed in villa, we preferred walking down to La Lucciola for breakfast. The fruit and bread were lovely, but we found the hot options and cereal a bit underwhelming.

Special mention has to go to the “extras”. Our package included generous allowances for spa services. These were beautifully done in the villa’s bale.  I had best the best massages of the trip. The room service menu, which is a 24 hour service provided a couple of lovely lunches and cold beers. The free local shuttle was also excellent.

I felt that One Eleven also provided excellent value. The food, drink and spa had prices quoted inclusive of tax and service. These prices were considerably lower than the other accommodation in Bali. I never felt ripped off, or as if I was being taken advantage of for staying in fine accommodation.

My only irritations were that staff had a bad habit of phoning the villa unnecessarily when the privacy button was switched on. This meant you had to get out of the bath or pool to run to the villas single phone (which was inevitably somewhere off the hook). I would highly suggest that staff adopt a higher threshold to make a phone call. I got in the habit of asking them not to call me back when I had a non-urgent question or enquiry, because it was really too much. Most memorably, I was contacted late in the evening prior to departure to enquire when I was to have my included in villa three course meal, when it was perfectly apparent that there was no opportunity left to use this.

Overall though, this was easily the best accommodation I stayed at in Bali. The accommodation with its lovely ambience was the most expensive, but the ancilliary services (food, spa, transport) were easily the cheapest and best quality.

text:
We stayed at One Eleven for a week in October. After spending a week with extended family we were ready for some serious R & R and pampering. We found It at One Eleven. A five minute walk to the main street for restaurants and shopping, this resort was ideally located.

This is a boutique group of Villas serviced by five star butlers and staff. The Villas are very luxe, minimalist and super stylish. The pool is large for a one bedroom villa and we enjoyed lazing by the pool with some tunes playing working on our tans. One Eleven forces you to relax.

The bed is extremely comfortable, bathrooms are large and there is an abundance of free amenities from sunblock, after sun, insect repellent and the usual standards. The Villas are spacious and have absolutely everything you need and if by chance they don't, the butler will get it!

The stand out at this villa was most certainly the staff. Our butler Agus was a beautiful gentleman and left no stone unturned. From restaurant bookings, cocktails, chauffers and suggestions Agus only had to be asked once. We will miss you Agus. Also Tina, the front desk Manager, always waiting with a smile and again, no stone left unturned.

The food at One Eleven was delicious. From the daily breakfasts cooked fresh in your villa ( we loved that you could add or request anything), room service menus even the cocktails were delicious. A highlight is Shiro Japanese restaurant, amazing sushi and sashimi. The timber fit out is also very luxe.

And lastly, the in-house treatments were the best we've had in all our years of travel. Ris, you just hit all the right spots! I cannot recommend the in-house massage, facials and treatments enough, the team is professionally trained and seriously sent us to bliss!

Thank you to David and the team for a really fantastic week. Ive been listening to the complimentary CD you gave us on departure all week and Bali dreaming again! One Eleven is a very well oiled machine with lots of charm and warmth.

We cant wait to come back next year. 

Terrie and Mark - Melbourne

I have spent 3 nights in the 111 Seminyak in September 2014 and am extremely happy of the choice. text:
We had high expectations for One Eleven, partly driven by the price and partly driven by the stays at the other Bali and Lombok luxury resorts we had already stayed in as part of our honeymoon in Indonesia.

The service was outstanding, as it was everywhere we stayed and came to expect in Bali and Lombok.

The villas are beautifully designed but in some aspects it felt like style over substance. Bedside lights were only accessible on one side of the bed for example and the sofas and dining chairs looked great but felt uncomfortable to relax in. When it comes to the breakfast, there are only two Western choices and one Indonesian main choice, which seems a little restricted particularly when we stayed at a 5 star boutique hotel resort in Ubud with unlimited cooked to order breakfasts with 10 choices and the quality of the food there was as good as any we have had in London. Little things perhaps but when charging luxury prices, the villas need to be luxurious in every way.

The worst thing about the resort however is that whilst it is marketed as a 'get away from it all' place where you can hide away from the world in a retreat with private spa treatments in  your villa, the noise from other residents can be a problem. We were unable to enjoy our massages in our villa or relax by our pool due to residents who played loud dance music from 8.30am in the morning from the ipod dock and speakers provided. The staff were quick to ask them to turn it down when asked but we could still hear the music and  hear them shouting in the pool. Either this is a resort for rest and relaxation or it is a party place, it can't really be both.

As I said, service and staff were excellent and perhaps we were unlucky on our stay but there is work to be done to clarify the issues that would really make this property excel.
title: Good but not great

owner_response.text:
Many thanks for your TripAdvisor review of your stay at One Eleven.  

Firstly, if I may thank you for recognizing the service offered by the One Eleven Team as they do take a lot of pride in ensuring our guests are well looked after and your kind words are sincerely appreciated. 

However it is your feedback that is most important to us and will be seriously looked into as we wish to exceed the expectations of all our guests.  

On your feedback of the breakfast menu variety, I do sincerely apologise that we failed to highlight that should you have any special requests or desire a specific choice of breakfast or any other meal that is not on our menu’s, we will do our very best to provide.  On this occasion, this was not adequately explained to you and I will certainly address this matter with all concerned to ensure that it does not happen again. I will also look at increasing the number of dishes on the breakfast menu, which is changed daily but offer our guests a greater selection of dishes.

I would also like to apologise for the noisy neighbours experienced during your stay.  Generally, our guests respect the privacy and convenience of others and this is not a regular occurrence. Regrettably, on this occasion they did not and we will certainly try to ensure as best we can, that others do not disturb the relaxation of our guests in adjoining villas. 

We are disappointed to hear your opinion on our furniture as we have received mostly positive feedback on this aspect of our villas. However we do respect your feedback and we will continue to look at ways in which to meet the needs of all and further improve the comfort for all our guests. 

With regards to the easy access of the light switches in the bedroom, I do appreciate your comments and thus have installed in each villa a remote lighting control switch that we hope will improve the convenience of our guests. I will also ensure that in the future, our butlers pay special attention when highlighting this feature to our guests on arrival.  I will also look at other possible enhancements for the lighting controls and see what can be done.

In spite of the matters raised, I do hope that overall you enjoyed your stay at One Eleven and Bali and I would like to thank you sincerely for staying with us. 

With best regards

David

text:
우선, 스미냑 시내 및 공항 픽드랍 서비스 너무 잘 이용했고 사실 이거 때문에 스미냑에서는 거의 고젝 사용을 안 했던거 같아요 승차감도 너무 좋아서 공항갈 때 진짜 너무 편했어요 그리고 직원 분들도 매우 친절하시고 일단 수영장 길어서 너무 좋아요! 단지 조금 아쉬운 것이 있다면 수영장에 햇빛을 피할 그늘이 없다는 점과 조식 메뉴가 한정적이라는 점? 그것을 제외하고는 진짜 너무 좋았습니다. 가끔 등장하는 귀여운 도마뱀들까지 저는 의외로 모기엔 많이 물리지 않았고 제공해주신 어메니티 샤워 젤로 씻었더니 몸에서 광 나더라구요 해바라기 샤워기라 필터를 교체할 수 없다는 것이 아주 약간 아쉽지만 또 가고 싶어요 발리에 가게 된다면 그때 또 묵고 싶을 정도이고 아 참! 혹 투어가 있어 아침에 일찍 나가야 된다면 말씀하시면 미리 조식 도시락도 싸주십니다 진짜 최고!!!

First of all, I used the pick-and-drop service from downtown Seminyak and the airport very well, and in fact, I think I hardly ever used Go-Jek in Seminyak because of this. The only regret is that there is no shade at the swimming pool and the breakfast menu is limited. Other than that it was really good. Even the cute lizards that appear from time to time, surprisingly, I didn't get bitten by mosquitoes, and after washing with the provided amenity shower gel, my body glowed. It's about and ah true! If you have a tour and need to go out early in the morning, tell us and they will pack a breakfast for you in advance. It's really the best!!!
title: 너무나도 만족하며 지내다가 갑니다!!!! 추천해요

text:
Great place to go to and unwind, recharge and renew. Love the serenity of the place, we enjoyed the  space and Al thought the resort was “full house” you don’t feel that, you see squirrels, birds around. Not much mosquitoes at all unlike other resort we stayed before. 

Udin our butler was not only kind and excellent, but even went out of his way to let us try local delicacies when we told him about it. 

They rotate breakfast options. Cooked right at your villa. Served hot. 

He also arranged and advised the timing of our breakfasts on our last day to ensure we get to the airport on time and unrushed. 

They do make you feel at home and safe. I don’t know if it’s the TWG chamomile or the peppermint that did it, but everything was well thought of. Even the fridge we can use to put fruits and the water generously provided with dispenser! 

Loved how Sinta booked restaurants, arranged our transport around Seminyak for shopping, quick money change, and to even other Spas , although we did try their’s too and it was lovely. 

Love their bath and body soaps, shower gels too. Nice natural combinations. 

We left well rested, & happy !

text:
3 nights here after a few days in the jungle.  Fantastic villas - now 11 years old so showing their age in a couple of places,  but really pleasant and comfortable - the photos dont quite do them justice.  Staff are fabulous,  so attentive and helpful without being intrusive.  Nothing's too much trouble.  A shuttle is available to local attractions.  Seminyak's a bit so so - tourism is coming back but it's far from busy - it must be very difficult in this part of Bali when tourism is at its height.   Daily in room breakfast is a highlight - delicious and 'just enough'.
There are only 2 concerns that we have with One Eleven.
1. The bed covering is too thick - the doona is what we would have for a cold night in southern Victoria - forces you to push the air conditioning really hard which seems silly.  And even then you're still hot.  Some lighter weight bed covering would help.
2. You're really vulnerable to neighbours who choose to be noisy,  as one of ours did one afternoon,  playing music that let's just say it wasn't too our taste.  The staff did respond to our request to reduce the volume but let's just say it seemed to get louder later in the day.  Rather spoiled an in house massage that we'd booked for that day.   The living area as you can see from the photos on this site is very open and basically abuts the neighbors' living area.  Simple solution is to remove the Bluetooth loudspeaker that each villa has in its living area - or put it in the bedroom ( which is well soundproofed).
Shiro,  the on site Japanese restaurant is terrific - loved our (largely Sushi) meal.
On balance,  a fabulous place to stay and very happy to recommend it.   
Just a couple of simple things to fix.
And hope you dont have noisy neighbors.
title: Great Villas - just let down a little by the neighbours

text:
My stay at one eleven was not as good as I expected. In fact, it was MUCH BETTER than my expectations. So no, the title is not an exaggeration. 
I’ve stayed in lots of villas in Bali, but nothing came close to this one. Everybody was just so friendly, accommodating, and always smiling, it feels amazing to be welcomed with such friendly faces.
The service at one eleven is impeccable, everyone really went above and beyond to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. I could call the receptionist at 4am this morning because of a terrible headache and they provided me with painkillers.
The villa itself is just beautiful. It’s spacious, much bigger than most villas. What I liked the most was how the villas actually have some green area and not just a swimming pool and walls like typical Balinese villas. The villa was also spotless. The speaker in the living room was broken on my first night, but they fixed it straight away the morning after.
My heart broke when I had to end my stay, it was just very dreamy.
A massive thank you for all of you lovely people who work at one eleven. Hope I will get to see yous soon!
title: The best villa in Seminyak

text:
Where do i start. If you are reading this thinking about booking. DO IT . I stayed here for 5 days 4 nights and i can not fault this place here are my reasons.

1) I loved how clean the villas are: When holidaying for me the most important is cleanest plce (i’m OCD , clean freak, so i tend to be very very picky and never stay below 5 stars for that reason). Being OCD, which is my problem, the staff would do anything to make it reach my expectations from changing linen more than once to extra towels and evening cleaning service (thats how bad i am) so rest assured really clean.

2) Service; my butler was Kadek. I stayed in Dubai Naseem Juierah (sister resort of Burj Arab-google it and see what i am comparing to) and the service from kadek and this hotel is unmatchable. 
One Eleven was def better. I had friends at W hotel who were very jealous of my villa and what i was telling them. Things like sunscreen, Aloe vera gel all were included (so nice and courtesy). Kadek also arranged all my tours and last but not least offered me a ride on his bike when taxi was not available. Thank you to one eleven. 

3) A Good hotel is easy to find (they need to and is business as usual) but the BEST hotels know how to deal with issues/problems/complaints that happen which may happen at times as no one/any place  is NOT perfect. 

I had 2 unfortunate issues (not in hands of the one eleven it was pure luck) i will not go into detail. The manager testa i think was AMAZING. Listened Assisted and resolved. The Fact they have no bad reviews is a testimony to how they are dealing with the issues (promptly,  empathetic and above and beyond). 

I also read the average reviews given to this resort. Just a reminder ur in the heart of seminyak but inside the villa feels like ur in your own sanctuary. There will always be external factors but i never had them at all (noise). I can not understand how someone can rate this plce below 4/5 . 

I am coming back for my honeymoon.
title: BEST VILLA EVER

Highly Recommend! Thanks for everything :)

Julian

text:
Spent a 4D3N at One Eleven and had the most wonderful time. The villa was highly recommended by a friend. My husband and I just loved the modern clean cut decor and style of the villa, precisely what we love. 

We loved having our own pool and the flamingo float gave it a little quirkiness. 

The bedroom and bathroom was wonderful. Loved the breakfast crew. Service was amazing and food was good too. We never got a chance to order room service unfortunately. 

Had the Omakase at Shiro Bar on our first night. It was ok but we have had better Japanese restaurant. Would have probably been better to order room service and spend more time in the villa instead. 

We had two massages during our stay and the masseuse were really good and professional. 

We loved how peaceful and quiet the villa was and how it was conducive for a wonderful quiet weekend away. 

Only downsides were the aircon in both the bedroom and spa house. They were not working well and were hardly cold despite it being at the coldest. But we have feedbacked to the villa and they will look into it. 

Also got some mosquito bites during our stay so slather on the complimentary mosquito repellent. 

Definitely highly recommend One Eleven and will come back again!
title: Amazing weekend away!

owner_response.text:
Dear cambriant,

text:
My friends and i stayed in the 3 bedroom penthouse and we had a great time. 
Particularly the service rendered by every staff there! Everyone was helpful and friendly, ensuring we had the best experience possible. 

Some of the key highlights: 
1. Breakfast Menu was changed daily and although we had only 4 pax, they still served us breakfast for 6 pax as the penthouse was made for 6 pax. Food quality was great and they always set up the breakfast so beautifully. 
2. Transfer service was offered as long as it is around seminyak, and transfer service to and fro the airport was certainly a plus point. 
3. Penthouse was huge and although the design could be better, i must say it was very comfortable for 4. We got to view the 1 bed room villas that they had and it was magnificent! 
4. Location was really good, 5 to 15 minutes walk away from key places of interests in seminyak, but it still felt private enough and not too noisy in the evening. There is a 24hrs convenience store next door and we got most of what we needed there. 
5. We booked for Spa session and they come right to your door step. The therepists were great and we even got a discount which made the spa sessions we had, very value for money. 

Things we felt could be better: 
1. TV in the penthouse is a tad too small for such a big living room area. we had to shift the sofa forward. 
2. 3 bedroom penthouse, but only 2 bathrooms, which are not huge. Hence i would not suggest having 6 pax in the penthouse, the wait for the toilet would have been a nightmare. we had 4 people, which made the toilet sharing alright. 
3. Pool was cold most of the time, you don't get a lot of sun over the pool. we do use the pool, but only during the noon when it was really hot, or the water, really is too cold. 
4. Would have been nice if the gazebo or penthouse has proper massage beds for our spa services. the massage was great and therapist were professional, just that our bedroom beds were just too soft. 
5. There were fans in the living room and dining area, but there is no way to control how strong the fan gets, only on/off. 
6. Nice kitchen and food prep area, will help if there are a couple more pots with proper cover so we that we can do more cooking.. 

With that said, we will still go back cause this place is beautiful!
title: Great Adult Only Accommondation

text:
Our stay at the villa was enjoyable and we had a great vacation. 
Things to note: Spray on their insect repellent (its rather useful) and bring mosquito patch with you. There's a lot of mosquitoes. 

Location - It's about 30mins drive from the airport and villa is located near to a lot of nice cafes and eateries. 

Service -  Check-in was also smooth and fast. Front desk staffs were polite and service was great. From the pick up and shuttle drivers, front desk, room service and chefs. The overall service we received from the staff were great. They were helpful and friendly and was prompt to respond to any request we had. 

Room - The villa was very spacious, clean and neat. Fan, aircon were working well. The outdoor sitting area was windy and quiet. Nice place to laze. Pool was clean and we brought our own float but without the pump. The service staff were nice to inflate it for us perfectly. The toiletries they provided were pretty extensive (it even include sunblock, insect repellent and cooling gel!)  The villa come with a pretty good bluetooth speaker so you can actually play your music while lazing at the pool. But of course had to keep the volume down so that it doesn't disturb the neighbouring villas (it can be pretty loud.) 

Food - food was great, we enjoyed our breakfast vey much. They provided snacks which we didn't have a chance to eat as we were out. We ordered for the BBQ for one of our night and it was pretty good as well. Though the skewers were a little dry and tough but the overall was good. 

Massage - we had the in-room massage and facial for 2 days and we enjoyed it very much. The massage room can be a little hot in the evening. One of the day we had it at about 4pm and the sun was shining straight my face. So its better to book it at about 5pm onwards. The masseurs were great and nice people. The price is also quite reasonable.  

Other things to note - it rained on the last day of our stay and there were a lot of dirt being washed down from the rooftop into our pool. There were some wooden bits as well, guess the wooden rooftop corroded and the bits and dirt were coming off. So just check the pool before using it. 
Bring lots of mosquito patch with you and spray on insect repellent. The villa do provide the insect spray and they come by to place the mosquito coil every evening. It reduces by a little but it doesn't seem to be able to keep the mosquito entirely off. There were a couple of them in our room and the bathroom, so just keep the room door closed as much as possible. 

Overall we had a great stay, we enjoyed it and would probably come back again.
title: Enjoyable & pleasant stay

text:
Some years ago on another visit to Bali we watched the construction of One Eleven and were interested in its clean design architecture, open living and minimalist wow factor ambiance. For this reason we decided to say at One Eleven for our trip this year to Seminyak which was for 14 nights.

The friendliness and service of the staff really do encapsulate the passion they have in making sure every guests has a wonderful time. One of the hardest choices each morning is how you’d like your eggs cooked. Here, nothing can be too much trouble and it has been the surprising little things that has been the most enjoyable for us such as; complimentary hotel rides to restaurants or local shopping spots, the complimentary sweet or savoury hors d'oeuvre left in the fridge, inflatable lilos for your private pool (or not) and the turn down service each evening. 

Two dining recommendations I’d strongly encourage if decision making was difficult for you while on holidays is to:
1/  Experience Shiro, One Eleven’s sushi and sake bar on level 1. It’s only a very small space but a very impressive design with intricate wood panelling. Even more impressive is the Japanese cuisine both in presentation and taste that is prepared right in front of you; and
2/ One Eleven offers an in-villa BBQ dining experience which is fantastic. The team set up a barbecue in your villa and you are treated to a indulgent cuisine which we opted for the surf and turf which included
breads, salads, fish, prawns, squid, ribs, wings, chicken satay and beef plus dessert and fresh fruit. Great value for money and no need to dress up fancy or leave your villa.

Like all resorts and hotels in the tropics the weather elements can take its toll and One Eleven is no different with minor general wear and tear issues but everything is aesthetically pleasing, elegant and welcoming of your relaxing secluded get-away.

I can not highly recommend One Eleven enough, it’s well worth the quiet and tranquil peace of mind when trying to escape your home rat race. This is what vacations are about, doing absolutely nothing and loving it.

It would be remiss of me not to mention the most beautiful front of house staff member Rai who was amazing and would get any job in the world because of her natural fabulousness. Thank you sincerely Rai.
title: Indulgently beautiful

text:
When we first walked into our villa (it was night time) it was so beautiful it almost took our breath away. This was the most peaceful, relaxing and fabulous holiday we have ever had. The villa enclosure is simply stunning and everything, down to the bed linen, the pillows, the bathroom product, everything, is beautiful. I don't normally swim much but the pool is divine. A good size and the water a perfect temperature, refreshing, but not so cold that it's hard to get in. We had massages and other treatments in the gazebo, so beautiful to lie on the massage bed with the light breeze coming through the door and at the end to just be able to walk out of the gazebo and into the villa.

The breakfasts are simply delicious! You choose the night before which cooked breakfast you would like and the two chefs come in at the appointed time, lay your table, cook your breakfast then leave. Their attention to detail is extraordinary from the artistic layout of the fruit platter to the flower strategically placed on the food to turning the yoghurt round the right way so that the diner could see the label without having to lift a finger.

The service that the staff give is very warm, friendly, discreet, respectful, professional and thoughtful. The senior butler is the epitome of a senior hospitality professional who knows exactly what to do to make your holiday the most memorable ever. 

The driver service is incredible, they will take you anywhere you want to go in Seminyak and then pick you up again when you call. 

The senior butler provided some day tour options for us and then organised a driver to take us touring for the day. 

The villas are most of the time peaceful and tranquil. We did have one loud neighbour for about two days and the rest of the time it was totally quiet and peaceful.

My husband and I will definitely be returning to One Eleven.

Our butler organised tours and helped us throughout the week. The drivers would happily take us to restaurants or other places we needed to go and pick us up afterwards all as part of the service. Their friendly helpful tips were much appreciated. 

You can’t review One Eleven and not mention the breakfasts! Having your choice of breakfast cooked for you in your villa at a time to suit you is really really nice. It’s even nicer when the breakfast is Michelin standard. 

All in all staying at One Eleven villas makes for an exquisite 5 star luxury holiday - we will most definitely return.

text:
I chose One Eleven after scouring the internet for the best place for peace and relaxation and to celebrate our two-year wedding anniversary.  We planned to spend about half the money, but upon finding the consistent, outstanding reviews for One Eleven decided it was well worth it for what seemed like a guarantee on the most peaceful environment (One Eleven does not allow young children – a huge draw for us as we will not be at a pool with screaming children).  My husband works long hours at a stressful job and we intended to spend this vacation reconnecting and recharging.  We stayed 4 nights here.

Villas – absolutely heaven.  They are even more gorgeous than they look in the photos.  The pool is huge and sparkling, the lush yard and gardens and palm trees are incredible.  The way the pool and garden lights up at night makes you feel like you are in a dream…  The bed is literally on a block of concrete (no rocking or shaking due to crappy bed frames – my pet peeve as a light sleeper) and the king-size mattress and pillows are lovely (you have extra firm pillows in the closet) and relatively noise-proof villa with black out shades are about the best guarantee of a fantastic night sleep you can get.  I do not sleep in late and I slept in at least 2 hours longer  each day when we didn’t set an alarm than normal. The gazebo for spa services is gorgeous.  Short of your own private island, this is hands-down the most beautiful place we've been and we love and appreciate design and aesthetics.  We spent a good portion of the vacation marveling at this.  All of the details (down to a neck bolster being provided for with the lounge chairs) are there.  I could have done with better lighting for makeup in the bathroom and rain shower heads aren’t my favorite but in the scheme of things this is forgettable.  

Spa services – I did three “invigorating” 60 minute massages in the gazebo.  I would say they were about a 6.5 or 7 / 10 on massage quality and for the price I was totally happy with this (they work out to be about $30 USD after the discount – CHEAP).  Getting a massage to the sound of the wind in the palm trees and birds singing is magic.  If you open the sliding doors, the breeze blows through the gazebo….  Just imagine.  Sadly 2 of 3 of my massages were interrupted by noise issues (see noise below).

Staff – the staff, like everyone says, is fantastic.  They clean and straighten everything up your room and freshen all of the pool and bathroom towels and robes unlimited and with a smile.  They offered to cook our breakfast before breakfast hours on our last day when we had to leave early for the airport without us asking.  Every time we called to complain about noise issues (maybe five times??), they were apologetic and worked to resolve them (see noise issues below).  The free shuttle to and from Seminyak and the airport was super handy, friendly, and comfortable.  I think we paid something like $30 USD for them to pick us up from our first stay in Ubud.  Anywhere you go, you can get a ride back by asking the restaurant to call 111 and send the shuttle back for you.  A GREAT amenity.

Food – the food is good, not amazing, but good enough that we preferred the luxury of eating all of our meals except dinner at the villa even though we planned to eat breakfast and lunch out more often.  And we are picky about our food.  They provide an afternoon/evening snack each day.  We had dinner at Shiro one night.  It was good also, again not amazing, but good.  We’d eat there again.  Convenient and fresh and not super expensive.  The “minute steak” and crepes at breakfast were the standouts, along with the fresh juice.  You get to choose from about 4 menu items per day (they change daily) the evening prior what you’d like for breakfast and can either schedule breakfast then or call the next morning and get it made in your villa 30-45 minutes later.  7 am to 11 am.  It comes with a bread/pastry bowl, some muesli, yogurts, and delicious jams.

Location – the location is great.  You could walk anywhere if you wanted.  We picked OneEleven for the location in proximity to all the great restaurants but ended up eating all meals at the resort except dinners and barely leaving.  A shuttle will drop and pick you up anywhere for free if you don’t want to get sweaty/dusty and you are dressed up for going somewhere nice.

Pro Tip – the only thing I forgot to bring was a pool raft.  Floating on a raft in that pool with my book was the only thing that was missing to make my vacation perfect (aside from the noise, again, see below).  When I called to ask the front desk where I could buy one, they HAD THEM AVAILABLE!!!  About twenty minutes later they delivered one, blown up and ready to go.  I couldn’t stop laughing – it was shaped like a flip flop.  I called to see if they had another one longer (I am 5’9” tall) and they brought another shaped like a soft pretzel, complete with the salt dots painted on.  I was laughing with the staff member who brought it in with a big smile.  35 years old, laying on a flip  flop and pretzel floaty with a Chivas Regal in my hand… My kind of life.  Kudos to the person who had the brilliance to buy these hilarious floats, they were the “cherry on top” of the cherry already on the top.  

Noise – after all of the consistently good reviews and research I did, I am nothing short of shocked to be sitting here writing this after our trip.  Any single one (or two) of these events would have been fine on its own, but for me the sum total of the events seriously detracted from the stay and how much we were able to relax and enjoy ourselves.  Our expectations were set high by the incredible reviews (only 2 reviews complaining of noise since 2014).  The staff did everything they could to take care of each situation, however we felt purely uncomfortable by the end of the trip for all of the requests we had to make.  The staff granted our request for the villa furthest from the road and we were delighted.  The first morning we woke up to two solid hours of the most heinous kids screaming and yelling coming from over the walls of our villa (Villa 9) from a neighboring resort.  We called to see what they could do, if anything, and they offered to move us to Villa 6 at 2 pm.  We retreated to the bedroom to watch tv until it was over.  On the heels of checking in to the new villa, the neighbors at OneEleven had their music on loud, not blaring but loud, and right over the wall from where our lounge chairs were.  We requested the staff asked them to turn it down and they did.  The kid noise from the previous day was no longer an issue – it was distant and faint.  Later the SAME day, in the middle of my massage, the villa neighbors on the other side checked in and were what I will call “yell-talking” and being so ridiculously loud that I had to get up during my massage and make a third request.  They quieted down a LOT, however some people are loud no matter what they do.  They talked all night until after we went to bed.  We set our alarm especially early to wake up and have a little break from this.  They seemed like the “going out late, sleeping in late” type and so when their doorbell rang at 7 am for their breakfast my heart sank.  The staff rang their doorbell 7 or 8 times for about ten minutes until they woke up and answered.  They had talked continuously throughout the entire night and next morning in their living area of the villa.  By lunch time, I was tired of being an involuntary part of their never-ending conversation, it felt really intrusive.  

I did not want to spend a second day in the bedroom of the villa and would have been willing to pack all our stuff and move a second time to get the quiet we came for.  When I called, the staff told me they were checking out.  I was relieved.  We enjoyed about 3 blissful hours of quiet.  I had a third massage scheduled later that day and in the middle of this massage for the second time, the OTHER  neighbors decided to FULL ON BLAST their club music, louder than the first time.   It covered up the little wooden flute music the masseuse had playing and I just laid there, resigned and done and completely incredulous.  My husband heard it and called and about ten minutes later, they stopped playing it.  I cleaned up for dinner, we left, returned and went to bed, woke up the last morning we were there to leave and had a quiet morning.  At this point I got back on TripAdvisor to re-read the reviews for OneEleven to see if I had missed something.  I don’t know if we were the most unlucky people in two years or if others just don’t write about their bad experiences.  The worst part for us was being left to be the judge of what is reasonable between our vacation desires and someone else’s.  I really felt like some kind of referee based on all of the noise issues.  All of the noise carries and we seeked this place out for the reviews and quiet and were willing to pay a premium for it.  I do believe others just end up here without really understanding the type of environment the resort is attempting to create, and plug in their iPod feeling like king of the world and ready to party or spend all day night joyfully and loudly reconnecting with old friends.  Others (like us) show up with real expectations of peace and quiet based on previous reviews only to be seriously let down.  At a resort of this caliber, I would have really liked the staff to notice how much trouble we were having and take some leadership in the situation to make the situation right beyond just resolving the individual incidents as they continued to happen, rather than leave it in my hands to bring to them.  I felt like I was playing a game of Whack-a-Mole managing the noise issues.  

When this place is good, it is absolute magic and soul healing.  It is somehow naturally incredibly quiet – no dogs, no traffic noise except in the very front, nothing but the beautiful wind in the palms and birds and gentle sound of the water in the pool.   There would be no issues if everyone was observant of how much noise carries and I think most people that stay here are this way.  When you are unlucky it is a big let down and not worth the money.  I would love to come back again and again for the rest of my life I loved it so much when it was quiet if I could just be sure that this stay was only one in a thousand stays.  In the end, I do believe we were simply very unlucky and maybe the exception.  I plan to stay here again in the future and when we do, I will return to update this review with (hopefully) the experience that most people have.  If it is another of the same, refereeing obnoxious noise problems to get the peace and quiet I expected, maybe it is simply time is to leave some less than stellar reviews to bring the overall picture back down to a more accurate one.

TO BE CONTINUED…
title: Too Many Noise Problems Spoil Otherwise Heavenly Vacation

owner_response.text:

text:
From the moment we arrived, we were very impressed. The villa is very spacious and beautifully air conditioned in the bedroom and bathroom. It's a welcomed reprieve from the heat. 
The bed, pillows and linen are wonderfully comfortable and we slept incredibly well every night of our 9 night stay. 
All high quality amenities are supplied: sun block, after sun cooler, body moisturisers, shampoos and conditioners, shower gel and bath salts. The shower and bath are huge with fantastic water pressure so that if you desire a bath, the hot water doesn't run out. 
Each day you're given different breakfast choices and it is cooked in the villa kitchen and perfectly presented. The staff manage to do this very discreetly. There's no intrusion and you feel very secure and private within the high walls around the private garden, pool, massage pavilion and villa. Night time is tranquil, there's no noise, the garden lights up and the pool is at a perfect temperature for swimming all day and night. It is literally two steps from every part of the villa. 

The staff are well trained and very respectful, attentive and eager to please. 

One Eleven is approximately a 5 minute walk to the Main Street of Seminyak and 15-20minutes to the beach. 

Every aspect of this property, location and service is excellent.
title: Excellence at its best

text: The villas of One Eleven are an extremely lovely and private experience. There's a serenity to staying here which is completely the opposite experience to the busy and sometimes hectic pace of Seminyak. The staff are wonderful - they are attentive, engaged, beautiful and friendly. The rooms themselves are of course house-proportioned... most of your living area is out of doors and the bedroom and immense bath are in air-conditioned comfort behind glass. The privacy of the pool and the beauty of that courtyard with its integral private spa treatment pavilion are wonderful. You can walk to just about any of the great restaurants and bars in Seminyak... but you may find you don't want to leave your villa that often. The quality of the spa treatments is just exceptional - among the best in Bali. A minor, minor suggestion for improvement might be the breakfast which although it is freshly prepared every morning could be improved with a slightly more fresh approach... cooked breakfast is lovely but not always a great idea in the tropical heat. But we have to say that One Eleven was among the best hotel experiences we have had. A memorable stay.

text:
1 11 is a superb private service experience above all things. The experience is built on great foundations of location (5 mins walk to Semanyak square), simple, elegant villa design, quality amenities, exclusivity (there are just 9 villas in total) and an "adults only" maxim.
If you are looking for a private, intimate, full service experience then 1 11 stands head and shoulders above all others in the Legian / Semanyak area (based on 20 years of visiting Bali and living in Indonesia, staying in many differing styles of accommodation).
The staff were all extremely attentive, responsive and tirelessly helpful; if you want to be pampered then 1 11 is a great choice.
Having a driver service was also extremely useful and a great way for guests less familiar with Bali to get their bearings. 
As per comments of previous reviewers, in-villa breakfast prepared by your private chefs is a nice touch and despite selections kept to a simple menu, staff were more than happy to accommodate specific requests.
This is a high end experience and is priced accordingly.  1 11 delivers.
The only minor detraction noted was simply the curse of operating in a tropical environment; maintenance and reinvestment in building and materials is a constant battle and 1 11 shows signs of ageing on villa fascia and decking.
It in no way detracted from the experience but is perhaps the only thing that holds 1 11 from being absolutely perfect.
I would endorse 1 11 for couples seeking a private, intimate, pampered oasis with all of Semanyak's many attractions at your door, ready to be enjoyed by private driver or just on foot.
title: Five star service

text:
From the moment we were picked up , we knew this was going to be a special experience.  All the staff from the GM down were a cohesive team. Everybody we came in contact with were exceptional. This was a happy place to work. 
When we arrived we were greeted by the GM and front office staff, offering us cool drinks and a genuine interest in us which made you feel special. We were ferried to our villa by golf buggy and shown around our villa having all features explained. The first glance was modern, beautifully minimalist and beautifully presented. These villas are exceptional , private and quiet. 
We had booked for dinner at Shiro which is part of One Eleven, I have already reviewed this and is with out a doubt a wonderful experience so we felt that it had set the tone for our holiday. 
The next surprise was breakfast which was prepared in our villa everyday at the time we choose. The night before we were asked what we would like and if there were any special requests. For instance I love a healthy vege and fruit juice as it  keeps my body in balance when I'm on holiday. I gave them the recipe and they were happy to make it fresh everyday, it was the best juice I have tasted and they used the best quality ingredients. They also sourced my favourite fruits which were included , beautifully presented peeled and cut ready for eating.
We just rang ½ hour or so before we required it, to let them know so they could prepare our breakfast which arrived with out exception with a team of genuinely lovely staff who were happy, smiling intelligent and excellent at their jobs . Everything is prepared fresh and cooked on site.
We enjoyed everything on offer from the great massages to an in villa dinner once again prepared by the very capable staff. 
They provided a car when we went out to restaurants and to do a little shopping which was a godsend for my husband who was suffering with a bad knee and was struggling to walk long distances . We needed to buy some gifts for our grandkids and decided on kites.( I thought they would be easy to find) ?? I think we were driven to about 4 places and no luck, when we decided to give that idea away and go back for a swim instead we happened across a little stall that had kites displayed. So stopped to purchase. Our driver even made sure we weren't being over charged. On our way back to the villa we must of seen about 5 different shops all selling kites. As they say Sods Law!. 
The villa pool is wonderful, large and big enough to do a little exercise or just cool off. 
One Eleven Villas are a great place to relax and wind down. You can do as much or as little as you want. We did the latter enjoying the tranquillity and peace that was offered. Privacy was paramount. 
This is a true 5 ***** experience. There is not one negative and we will be back. Thank you.
title: A Wonderful and Peaceful Holiday
